page.title: 17Cilcain Pupils' Life-Styles
page.content: A survey of the juniors at Cilcain School showed that most pupils have a bicycle, but that generally they walk to school or are brought by car. Most keep pets at home: dogs and cats are most popular, with rabbits and fish heading a list of others. All homes had colour television, with a majority also having a video-recorder. The school has a micro-computer, but 75% also have a computer at home. The pupils have a wide range of interests. About half are members of the Scout or Guide movements. Most popular sporting pursuits are swimming (nearly all can swim), football and riding. About 50% have travelled abroad and also flown in an aeroplane, generally on holidays to Europe. The children enjoy the friendliness and freedom of life in this small rural community and the peace and beauty of the countryside.
